title: Margherita Pizza (Skillet)
description: A quick skillet version of classic Margherita pizza with a crisp pan-seared crust, bright tomato sauce, fresh basil and melted mozzarella. Fast technique locks in a slightly smoky, chewy crust while keeping toppings vibrant and fresh.

ingredients.display_name: active pizza dough (store-bought or homemade), room temperature
ingredients.notes: enough for a 9-10 inch skillet; gently stretched to fit pan
divided: pan coating and finishing drizzle

ingredients.display_name: crushed San Marzano tomatoes or plain crushed tomatoes
fresh mozzarella, torn or sliced and patted dry
ingredients.notes: use low-moisture for less weeping or dry on paper towel
divided: sauce and dough edge seasoning

steps.text: Prepare the quick tomato sauce: in a small bowl combine crushed tomatoes, minced garlic, salt, sugar, black pepper and optional oregano; stir and taste, adjust seasoning.

Bring dough to room temperature if refrigerated; gently press or stretch dough on a lightly floured surface to a round slightly larger than your skillet, leaving some thickness at the edge for a crust.
Heat a 9-10 inch oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat; add 1 tablespoon olive oil and swirl to coat; sprinkle cornmeal or semolina into the pan to lightly dust the base.

Once oil is shimmering, carefully lay the stretched dough into the skillet; cook 2-3 minutes until the bottom is golden and blistered and the top begins to bubble; reduce heat to medium-low if browning too quickly.
Flip the dough using a spatula (or flip in two halves if needed) so the uncooked side is now on the bottom; quickly spread the tomato sauce over the cooked side, leaving a 1/2-inch rim.

Distribute torn/sliced mozzarella evenly over the sauce and tuck fresh basil leaves under some cheese if desired; drizzle remaining olive oil over the top and sprinkle a small pinch of salt around the crust edge.

Cover the skillet with a lid and cook on low-medium heat for 6-8 minutes until cheese is beginning to melt; then increase heat briefly to medium for 1 minute to encourage bubbling without burning crust.
Optional: for extra browning, transfer the skillet to a preheated broiler for 1-2 minutes watching closely until cheese is golden and bubbly.
Remove from heat, let pizza rest 2 minutes, finish with additional fresh basil and a drizzle of olive oil; slice in the skillet or transfer to a cutting board and serve.
